page.title: 15The Hartley Samson
page.content: William Carr was born on April 23rd 1756 at Hartley Old Engine, and in his prime was reputed to be the strongest man in the world. At the age of 17 he weighed 18 stones and stood 6ft 3in. He could lift a 700lb weight and throw a 60lb weight a distance of 24ft. By the age of 30 he had grown to 6ft 4in and weighed 24 stones. Carr followed his father into the blacksmith trade, and, whilst repairing an enging at Hartley, he once worked for 6 days and 5 nights with no sleep, then for a further 5 days and nights after some sleep.
